content.text: The way we interact with information is moving beyond static lists and keyboards. This topic explores the cutting-edge research in UI/UX for IR.
The rise of Large Language Models (LLMs) and Voice assistants. Instead of queries, users engage in dialogue. The system must maintain state and understand intent through multi-turn interactions.
content.hook: Siri, Alexa, and Gemini are the new 'browsers'.

slides.title: Modern Research Directions
items: Neuro-symbolic interfaces (combining LLMs with structured data).
Affective IR (sensing user emotion through behavior).

content.text: How do we measure 'Ease of use' or 'Joy' in IR? Research into biometric feedback (eye-tracking), EEG, and long-term user logs to understand satisfaction beyond just relevance.
outcomes: User experience (UX) as a ranking signal.

content.description: Imagine search 10 years from now. Will screens still be the primary interface? Describe a search scenario using AR glasses or brain-computer interfaces.
